Job Title: Director of Risk Management and Compliance

Location: North Chicago, IL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
Job Details

Job Location

Near North Health Service - Chicago, IL

Position Type

Full Time

Description

 Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of underserved communities? 

 Do you thrive in a role that allows you to lead and coordinate community health initiatives to improve the well-being of adults, children, and families? 

 If so, we have the perfect opportunity for you! 

Near North Health, a longstanding pillar of Chicago's healthcare landscape, is seeking a visionary and compassionate  Director of Risk Management and Compliance  to join our dedicated team. Since our inception in 1966, we have remained committed to our mission of providing accessible, affordable, and high-quality primary healthcare services to all, regardless of their financial circumstances.

As  Director of Risk Management and Compliance  , you will play a pivotal role in our mission to serve primarily low-income uninsured or underinsured residents of Chicago's medically underserved communities. Your expertise in fostering an ethical, transparent, and safe environment, encouraging the reporting of concerns and safeguarding whistleblower protections, will further solidify our position as one of the largest providers of community-based primary care in the city.

 Key Responsibilities  :

 Compliance Program Leadership: Develop, oversee, and evaluate the effectiveness of a comprehensive corporate compliance program, ensuring alignment with legal and regulatory requirements. Maintain and update the written corporate compliance plan annually.  Hotline and Reporting Mechanism Establishment: Establish and manage confidential and accessible reporting mechanisms, including a hotline, to encourage the reporting of concerns or suspected violations, ensuring all staff and stakeholders are informed and engaged.  Cultivation of Reporting Culture and Whistleblower Protections: Promote a culture of integrity where reporting suspected wrongdoing is encouraged and protected. Implement clear policies to protect whistleblowers from retaliation, in line with regulatory mandates.  Policy Development and Training: Create and update policies and procedures related to compliance and risk management. Develop the organization's Code of Ethics and ensure that all staff and board members receive appropriate training and education. 

 Qualifications  :

 Minimum Education: Bachelor’s degree in Health Administration, Law, Public Health, Nursing, or related field. This foundational education provides the broad understanding necessary for the complexities of healthcare compliance and risk management.  Preferred Education: Master’s degree or higher in Health Administration, Public Health, Law, or related field. Advanced degrees offer deeper insight and a more comprehensive understanding of the healthcare system, legal considerations, and advanced risk management strategies.  Certifications: Professional certifications such as Certified in Healthcare Compliance (CHC), Certified Professional in Healthcare Risk Management (CPHRM), or Certified in Healthcare Privacy and Security (CHPS) are highly desirable. These certifications demonstrate a commitment to ongoing professional development and a deep understanding of specific compliance and risk management areas.  Deep knowledge and experience in healthcare compliance, risk management, and ethics, including familiarity with local, state, and federal regulations, OIG and HRSA guidelines, and ECRI best practices.  Demonstrated leadership in developing and managing comprehensive compliance programs, with a strong emphasis on promoting a culture of safety and ethical conduct.  Proven ability in establishing effective reporting mechanisms and fostering an environment that supports whistleblower protections.  Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, capable of effectively navigating complex regulatory environments and promoting a culture of transparency and integrity.

 Why Join Near North Health  :

At Near North Health, we believe that everyone deserves access to quality healthcare, regardless of their financial circumstances. By joining our team, you will become part of an organization dedicated to making a positive impact in the lives of the most vulnerable members of our community. You will have the opportunity to lead and innovate community health initiatives that bring about meaningful change.

We offer a competitive salary and benefits package, as well as a supportive and collaborative work environment that values the contributions of every team member. As a  Director of Risk Management and Compliance  , you will have the chance to create a lasting legacy in the communities we serve.

 How To Apply  :

If you are excited about this opportunity and believe you have the skills and passion to lead our organization's compliance and risk management efforts, we encourage you to apply today! Please submit your resume and a compelling cover letter detailing your relevant experience and vision for community health at Near North Health by completing the information to the right, uploading your resume and clicking “Start Application”.

Near North Health is an equal opportunity employer and welcomes candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply. Let's work together to make a difference in the lives of our community members!

Join us at Near North Health and be a part of a legacy of care and compassion that spans generations. Apply now and let your impact be felt far beyond our nine health centers and nutrition site. Together, we can build a healthier, stronger Chicago for all.
